SEARCH
Package com.example.atlasevents.data

Class UserRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.atlasevents.data.UserRepository
Direct Known Subclasses:
FakeUserRepository
public class UserRepository extends Object
Repository class for managing User-related data operations in Firebase Firestore.

This class provides CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for users, including organizers and entrants. It handles data hashing (for passwords) and ensures that email uniqueness is maintained when adding or updating users.

    Callback interface for operations that return a list of users.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserRepository

      public UserRepository()
      Constructs a new UserRepository instance with Firestore and PasswordHasher initialized.

  • Method Details

    • addUser

      public void addUser(@NonNull User user, @NonNull UserRepository.OnUserUpdatedListener listener)
      Adds a new user to Firestore if the email does not already exist. The user's password is hashed before being stored.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object to add.
      listener - callback invoked with operation status.

    • getUser

      public void getUser(String name, UserRepository.OnUserFetchedListener listener)
      Retrieves a general User object from Firestore by email.

      Typically used during sign-in to validate user credentials and determine user type.

      Parameters:
      name - the email address of the user.
      listener - callback invoked when the user data is fetched.

    • getUsers

      public void getUsers(String type, UserRepository.UsersCallback callback)
      Fetches users from Firestore with the matching user type.
      Parameters:
      callback - The UserRepository.UsersCallback to handle success or failure.

    • setUser

      public void setUser(@NonNull String email, @NonNull User newUser, @NonNull UserRepository.OnUserUpdatedListener listener)
      Updates user information in Firestore.

      If the email is changed, this method checks whether the new email already exists. The old document is deleted only if the update is successful.

      Parameters:
      email - the original email of the user.
      newUser - a User object containing updated details.
      listener - callback invoked with update status.

    • getOrganizer

      public void getOrganizer(String name, UserRepository.OnOrganizerFetchedListener listener)
      Retrieves an Organizer object from Firestore by email.
      Parameters:
      name - the email address of the organizer.
      listener - callback invoked with the retrieved organizer or null if not found.

    • getEntrant

      public void getEntrant(String name, UserRepository.OnEntrantFetchedListener listener)
      Retrieves an Entrant object from Firestore by email.
      Parameters:
      name - the email address of the entrant.
      listener - callback invoked with the retrieved entrant or null if not found.

    • isOrganizerBlocked

      public void isOrganizerBlocked(String userEmail, String organizerEmail, UserRepository.IsBlockedCallback callback)
      Checks if a specific organizer is blocked by the user
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The email of the user
      organizerEmail - The email of the organizer to check
      callback - Callback with the result

    • blockOrganizer

      public void blockOrganizer(String userEmail, String organizerEmail, UserRepository.BlockedOrganizersCallback callback)
      Blocks an organizer from sending notifications to the user
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The email of the user
      organizerEmail - The email of the organizer to block
      callback - Callback with success/failure result

    • unblockOrganizer

      public void unblockOrganizer(String userEmail, String organizerEmail, UserRepository.BlockedOrganizersCallback callback)
      Unblocks an organizer, allowing them to send notifications to the user again
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The email of the user
      organizerEmail - The email of the organizer to unblock
      callback - Callback with success/failure result

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String userEmail)
      Deletes a user from Firestore by their email.
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The unique email of the user to delete.
